pull.title: [Wallet] move wallet help string creation to CWallet
pull.body:
Simple and easy-to-review refactoring to reduce wallets init.cpp polution and sets another step in the wallet separation / duplication. 

The only visible change to users would be, that the wallet help message part has now it's own `-help-debug` part (IMO desirable if we look at the wallet as it is a module)

issue.title: [wallet] Move hardcoded file name out of log messages

events.body: utACK apart from nit - great idea.
Concept ACK, but fix @laanwj's nit and the typo.

issue.title: [Wallet] move "load wallet phase" to CWallet
issue.body: Another simple and easy-to-review wallet/init.cpp refactoring

issue.title: Bitcoin wallet PRs 2
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#7576
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7577
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7608
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7691
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7905

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

issue.title: [Wallet][Refactoring] wallet/init refactoring backports
issue.body:
Adapts the following refactoring PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6961 Constrain constant values to a single location in code
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7576 [Wallet] move wallet help string creation to CWallet
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7577 move "load wallet phase" to CWallet
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7608 Move hardcoded file name out of log messages
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7691 refactor wallet/init interaction
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8776 Wallet refactoring leading up to multiwallet

comments.body:
Better not to put string constants in header files. This causes problems, such as duplication - either undetected and wasting space in the executable, or explicit linker duplication errors.

Better to make it "extern const char*" and define the value in the implementation file.
@jonasschnelli Please address the feedback so this can be merged next week.
Yes. Will fix is in the next coupl of hours. Thanks for the reminder.
